content.description: Â© Werner Forman Archive/The Bridgeman Art Library
content.question: Great Zimbabwe most likely served elite rulers as

choices.label: an outpost for Phoenician traders dating back to 2,000 B.C.E.
a thriving fourteenth-century Shona site that was part of an extensive trade network
a remote and secure fortress for Shona leaders during fifteenth-century periods of unrest
a meeting point for merchants traveling to and from the Swahili coast

content.answer: a thriving fourteenth-century Shona site that was part of an extensive trade network

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Describe contextual elements of a work of art (or group of related works of art), including-  a. function.  b. context.  c. siting or physical context.  d. subject matter.  e. reception.
